The claim is based on an online report p: 2019, which states that a Philippine House of Representatives committee rejected a bill renewing ABS-CBN's franchise.
The headline of the report: when translated to English, states that Congress has already given its verdict, confirming that ABS-CBN will close down on March 30, 2020.
The article: when translated to English, mentions that the lower house has reached a decision and the committee has rejected ABS-CBN's request for franchise renewal.
President Rodrigo Duterte has expressed: CBN's franchise due to the network's alleged refusal to air his campaign ad during the 2016 presidential elections.
